definition: to lead by the hand/to guide/to support
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
to carry/to take along/to bring along/to hold (hands)/also pr. [xi1]

sentences.english: If the jade advisers and assists in everywhere she, and be ambitioning to talk a few lines for her in madam's in front.
sentences.chinese: 如玉處處提攜她，而且在夫人面前肯爲她說幾句話。

sentences.english: It is through our consecration that we are able to find her hand in the midst of darkness.
sentences.chinese: 透過我們的奉獻，才能讓我們在黑暗中找到她的提攜。

sentences.english: Radiographic assessment of osteoarthritic changes and the carrying angle was also performed.
sentences.chinese: 通過X線對骨性關節炎的變化和提攜角進行評估。

sentences.english: The boss might give you a brawlotion, but don't hold your breath.
sentences.chinese: 老闆可能要提攜你，但別太殷切期望。

sentences.english: We don't want to advance the younger employee in prejudice of the elderly.
sentences.chinese: 我們不願意提攜較年紀輕的職員而有損於較年長者。

definition: making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
(Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
to offer advice/to make a suggestion
to make a contribution/to establish/to found/contribution
the younger generation/those who come after
to spare no pains or effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
see 承前啟後|承前启后[cheng2 qian2 qi3 hou4]
a heavy load and a long road/fig. to bear heavy responsibilities through a long struggle (cf Confucian Analects, 8.7)
